text_sample: <s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: Hello Reddit!    I was talking with my SO the other day and came up with this question. If the world was completely religionless, would the human race still have developed morals without the teachings of your own personal religion?    She argues that humans lack the ability to make "moral" decisions without a role model due to the chaotic nature of a human being.   I on the other hand believe that religion is just an easy example to base morals off of because of how prevalent it has been for the past 3,000+ years and was used to justify a world we didn't understand yet. Surely, with all the advancements in science and technology we would be capable of morals. Humans would have made justice eventually. So what does Reddit think?! ### Response: Would a world without religion be possible and could humans develop moral codes without the influence of any religious leaders or holy texts? Could a society function without a belief in a higher power? What kind of moral code do you think a secular huma

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: So I´ve been thinking about this for some time, and I´m sure I want to break up. Over the last month I`ve just lost interest in my GF, she`s often negative and gets easily hurt/annoyed over small things.   Dont judge me on the following: Also, the girl I lost my virginity to is really into me and I`ve had a crush on her since I lost my virginity to her. She slept over recently and she´s going to sleep over on friday.  However, I dont want to mention this to my current gf as a reason for the break up. All in all I just want to break up without telling her a reason, but I know that would be unfair towards her.   How do I break it to her without coming of as a dick or anything? (Even though I am)  Also I think about doing it over the phone (calling her) concidering she lives an hour away and I can`t be bothered to travel 2 hours for a break up. ### Response: how do i tell my long distance GF that im breaking up with her without coming off as a dick or being too direct? And should I do it over the phone? (I think id be more comfortable doing it that way.)

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: I'm starting to feel "restless" in the relationship, and since this is my first long-term deal, I'm worried that I'll either a. ignore the signs of being dissatisfied or b. become consumed by them.  I love him, and he is the sweetest and most amazing person, but I don't think there's really any passion. And when I think about that aspect, I don't feel excited, just kind of bleh. But this has been a recent development, and I might just be spiraling into a panic mode because I don't know if it's normal to feel so apathetic about someone at times.   I constantly fantasize about being with other people, both intimate and just in a casual, romantic way. But I've never found somebody that I've been more compatible with than him, so maybe I'm just being ridiculous.  We're so tied down together, in finances, and intertwined life, I might also be feeling a little trapped, like I couldn't leave if I wanted to. It took me awhile to feel comfortable with a commitment to begin with.  Am I just being selfish? I'm in something pretty damn perfect, but wondering if it could all be better.  I'm a bit overwhelmed, and feeling kind of crazy. Any advice from a third party would be appreciated! ### Response: 1 year relationship, recently developed feelings of apathy/dissatisfaction despite loving partner - need reassurance things are okay despite minor doubts/worries. Please advise! Thanks!! :)*** EDIT: Just want to

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: About a month ago we started having problems with our cable. The picture would get pixelated (sp?) and the sound would cut out, couldn't control the menu via remote or anything. Did the usual, called TWC, had the support person reset my HD DVR box and it worked again...for five minutes. Called back, they did the same thing and it didn't fix the problem.  They sent a technician out to the house. He tried three new cable boxes, his own HDMI cables, my own HDMI cables and still wasn't able to resolve the problem. He finally resorted to hooking up component cables so we can still watch in HD, however, this has now produced a distracting feedback from my speakers due to all of the unnecessary wires.  I know there is not a problem with any of my hardware setup (the TV and Receiver work just fine and my ### Response: Time Warner Cable Box stopped displaying picture and sound for about a month before sending someone out who doesn't have a solution yet. Is there ANYTHING that can be done until then? Or am I stuck with these ugly w

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: I posted this in /r/computers but thought I'd try here as well.  I have an XPS M1330 that has shat the bed like so many others with the NVidia chipset. No power, no nothing. The system is out of warranty, but I have been told that due to lawsuits etc, Dell will replace, not repair these units if you can get to the right person on the phone. The best option I have gotten from Dell so far is a $200 discount off a $500 repair. AFAIK these repairs often don't last 90 days before failing again. Are there any Redditors here in the know that can help facilitate a replacement for me? I used to be an L2 at Dell back in the day, but I know longer have any contacts on the inside. ### Response: 4 yoa xps m1330 nvidea chip dead. wont fix under warranty unless i pay big bucks. need advice on replacing or helping someone who can. pls halp! :^) :)

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: So as the title says she pierced her ears and it is something that I am extremely turned off by. Yeah i get it i sound stupid but there it is. I have told her how I feel and said I will try to change how I feel. I also told her that no matter what she decides I will support it and do my best to live with it, but she will have to deal with the consequences. I need help on how I can find a way to not be super turned off. Help please and thank you  edit: she has 5 in each ear. ### Response: girlfriend of 2 years pierced her ears and now I am super turned off. Need advice on how to learn not to be. Please and Thank You. Edit: she has 5 in each ear.**  edit: She

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: I(22) met a girl(23) last Summer, and we became really close on the run-up to Christmas. It's my first real relationship, although she's been engaged in the past. We get on great, and I've really fallen for her.  **The Problem**  She goes back to her country(France) in early April. Past this point, i know that i will only be able to see her once every few months. We both knew that it was a bad idea to get into a relationship, but i cant help how i feel for her.  I was just wondering if reddit could advise me on how to approach the next few months, and if there is any point in continuing the relationship at all. ### Response: 1st real relationship, she goes back to France early April, not sure whether or not to continue with it... Advice please!? :) xxx ANDYxxx :( :P ;) \*EDIT\*\_ sorry for spelling

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: How can I help her?      My girlfriend's ex is constantly giving her hell, he's posting stuff about her all over the internet and spreading rumors about her.   We're in a long distance relationship so I've never met him I only know what he looks like from her pictures of him.   She constantly talks about things he's said to her and how he treated her, I hate talking about exes but it's not really something I can avoid entirely.   She said she's feeling ill about the things he has said but she refuses to tell me what he has said and where he has said it.   If you want any extra information ask in the comments.      We've been together for 6 months and they where together for 2 years so he probably knows more about her than I do. ### Response: Girlfriends ex is harassing her on the Internet and spreading lies about her.  She won't tell me exactly what he said or where he said it. Need advice on what steps I can take to help her.

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: Have been dating current boyfriend for 3 years and a couple months. He seems like he isnt interested in me. Should I do something to change my look? Anybody out there had this happen? Help please! ### Response: 3 year relationship with declining interest from bf. What should I do? <s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: So, I've had a crush on this guy I met in high school for three years. <s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: The other night I was leaving a bar with friends after a couple of drinks, when an argument between these two drunk girls started outside. They looked like your standard very attractive clubbing girls - tight, short dresses with a generous helping of makeup. Mix that with drunk, and they are the type of people I would normally avoid.  However, as we were walking past, it turned out that they were having a full-out brawl over their political differences. Talking about neoliberalism, they bandied around names like Adam Smith, John Rawls, Aristotle, Foucault etc. It was bizarre.  In the end, a crowd formed around them just watching them have this massive argument, that ended with slapping and hair pulling. The girls had to be separated. One girl started crying, while the other girl raised her arms in victory and yelled "AND THE WHITE CRUSADER WINS AGAIN!" (she was not white).  Is this an isolated incident? What are some of your unexpected and unique drunk stories? ### Response: 2 drunk girls got into an argument over neoliberalism; they then proceeded to engage in a hairpulling and slapping marathon with a crowd of people watching. Was this a unique situation or is this something that

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: Hot and steamy affair (known for 15 years, actual relationship approx 6 months+ long distance) quickly turns into love and promises of marriage and children. We both thought it was true love and we planned extensively for our future. We shared our deepest, darkest secrets with each other, among other things. Now, months after families are involved and things are publicly proclaimed, they are backing away. They cite the huge changes in their career and their justifiably related fear. They say they must focus on their job and can't have any distractions, for safety and sanity. Their concerns are legitimate. We face the next 3 years+ with little to no contact. SO is scared and wants me to move on, but doesn't want it to be over. They say they are mentally shutting down and I don't deserve this. Yet, they want to remain friends and not tell family and friends it's over. > ### Response: 4 year relationship ends by "choice" of SO due to work/life balance. They still want to stay friends despite feeling abandoned/betrayed. What do? Is moving on the right choice? Should I let them make the first move

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: Hi, I'm from California and my grandma has been in a sticky situation with her home.  A neighbor next door to my grandma was seeking reimbursement for repairs since there were holes in their house that came from my grandma's yard.  But it turns out the previous owner of my grandma's house caused those damages.   So after inspections and everything, the neighbor's insurance reimbursed him about $1600 to make the repairs.  Now's the sticky part: The insurance company's lawyers sent a letter to my grandma asking for reimbursement for what they paid the neighbor.   We've tried contacting our home insurance to deal with them but have been getting no calls back. We were thinking of writing a letter to OUR insurance company including the letter from the neighbor's lawyer and let them handle everything.  My grandma is just worried about losing the house. Thank you guys so much in advance. ### Response: Neighbor wants money from my grandma for repairing their own damages. Turns out it was the former owner of my grandma's house that caused those damages. Now the neighbor's insurer is asking my

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: let me just say that I love what you guys are doing and more power to you.  I come to you asking for some wisdom. My gf, who I have no problem with what so ever and love just the way she is, seems to be down on her self alot lately because of her weight. I personally haven't  noticed... sure her boobs are a little bigger and her butt got juicier.. but that's not really something that i frown upon. Well last night we were talking kind of heart to heart and she told me she had gained 20 lbs in the last 6 months...   Like I stated earlier, I did not notice at all. But I dont like seeing her down. I told her I would help her out with a diet plan (she just got a gym membership). So here I am asking you all for some help. I am personally a fit person, but it just comes naturally. I dont work out and i eat almost everything i want whenever i want and i keep a lean 175. Obviously I am the last person who should be giving diet tips. Can you all please leave some comments and let me know some of your tips/tricks? Or even a general plan to stick to... ### Response: GF has gained 20+lbs in the past 6 months - need tips & tricks on staying motivated and keeping healthy food intake. Looking forward to hearing from you all! :) Thanks!!**

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: I (21f) have been dating my SO (26m) for a few months now, and I am sure he is the one. He is my best friend, my other half. We are both in recovery and this past weekend I was scared that he may have been using. I confronted him every time I suspected there was something going on, turns out I was just being paranoid. After spending three days upsetting him with my worry and distrust, I decided to sleepover to try and comfort eachother. I was feeling under the weather and took some Nyquil to go to bed, as I was drifting off to sleep, he had told me that he loved me, and I responded with "I love you too [different male name]"!!!! Wtf is wrong with me?! We had been talking about exes earlier that evening, but that is no excuse. For the record, the guy's name I said is someone who I do not associate with anymore. I love my this man, do you think we can move past this? ### Response: 21f called her boyfriend another man's name during a sleep over after weeks of being insecure in their relationship. Will they get passed it? What should she do to make it better? Any suggestions would be great! Thank

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: In the past 10 months, I've had four bad encounters with four separate guys who all shared an extremely specific physical type.  I think this means that that type is "not meant for me".  (The four guys were not conventionally attractive men, and I think most women would be unattracted to their type, but for some reason, I was to it.)   I just got over the last of the four and had to sort of cold reboot my heart and loins to do it, so maybe because of that, right now I just don't find any guys at all, their faces, their bodies, or personalities, very interesting.    At the same time, I do need to get into a new guy, and do it now, in order to put the period at the end of Guy # 4's era and move on.  How are "types" decided for us, how do they form, and how do I find a new one?  Do we consciously decide what our type is?  If so, how do I do that?  And if not, what does decide it and how can I influence that process or speed it up? ### Response: What is my type, and how do I find a new one?  Is there such thing as "the One", and if so, how do I find him/her?**  **PS:** Thank you for your help!

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: My boyfriend of almost a year has recently started having phases where he is in a bad mood and gets grumpy for a few days at a time. He keeps apologizing for it and says he just has a lot on his mind, and that he thinks he needs to get his life together. He is an honors student majoring in mechanical engineering at a prestigious university, so I'm not sure how his life could be more together.   I've noticed that these down phases he's had come after he does shrooms and I'm convinced they're making him think things about himself that aren't true (I don't know much about shrooms or any drugs really). I want to be there for him and help him feel better, but I don't want to come off preachy about how he shouldn't do drugs if he reacts that way to them.   I guess what I need help with is how to address this situation and how I can be a good friend to him. I'm a very straightforward person and generally not a very comforting person so I feel like I'm going to end up sounding like an inconsiderate asswipe by telling him to just stop doing drugs. It's also not really my place to tell him what to do with his life so there's that, too. ### Response: How do I be supportive of someone who is having a rough patch while also discouraging drug use? Should I even try to be supportive/what should I say? Can I ever be comfortable talking about this sort of thing

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: Over the past year I've grown in so many ways and learned so much about myself, love, and life in general. I want to commemorate my personal growth with another tattoo. A constant reminder of the new individual I've become and where I came from.   I want something small and in black and grey ink... possibly on my wrist or the back of my neck. I'm looking for some sort of symbol or image that represents growth, and despite it constantly being in the back of my mind for a couple of weeks I am still stuck.  Any and all ideas are welcome! ### Response: Looking for a small tattoo design representing growth (could be anything) on the back of my neck/wrist area. Need help coming up with an idea! Help please :)!**  Thank you in advance!! ~Kath

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: I live in a dorm and have a roommate, and I went home this past weekend. I got back this morning, and saw that my bed was arranged differently than how I left it. My roommate said he had a friend over, and that friend decided to just sleep in my bed. My roommate said that he was asleep when his friend got in my bed, so it's not really like he gave him permission, but he allowed it after he went ahead and got in.   I don't know this friend personally, I only hear stories, and I already know I don't fucking like them. It weirds me out either way that this happened without my knowing. Perhaps I'm overreacting to a lot of you, but it just feels like a personal violation, and I'm kind of pissed about it.   I told my roommate that that's not okay, and he just replied "Oh, well, alright." How should I handle this? I feel like I'm not done with the issue. ### Response: Roommate had a friend sleep in my bed while I was away from school, I heard stories of this person beforehand and am uncomfortable with it regardless of what is/isn't legal. What do? Probably

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: My girlfriend and I saw/heard a couple across the street fighting and then witnessed the man run into the house, begin assaulting the woman, and slam the door. Knowing there was at least one small child over there, we called 911. The cops came and took our info and statements but said they would contact if they needed anything. Fast forward a few weeks and we get summoned to testify against him in court.  We only called 911 because we feared for the safety of the kid(s). Only later did we find out the guy is a rumored drug dealer on probation. We really don't want to shit where we eat and we certainly don't want to fuck with drug dealers. Still, we don't want someone like this living across the street from us so we'd like to help put him away if we can. The letters we got say that if we don't show up, we can be "punished," but is this really true? Do we have the right to refuse to testify or to state our demands, for example that we do not want him to see who we are? ### Response: 911 dialed for domestic violence w/ children involved; now being subpoenaed to testify in court but don't want to risk putting ourselves + other neighbors in danger by doing so. What are our rights?

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: I went up to my lake house with a few friends and I didn't tell my parents that we were going. Basically after coming back my dad asked me where I was, and I kept with my original story of going to my friends house. Obviously that didn't work out because my dad's friend saw me up there and said something to him. So now that I am caught in this lie, my parents are probably going to become way more strict, and not let me do things anymore.  I understand that I lied to them and that was wrong. But I think that they should understand that I'm a teenager and I'm gonna do mischievous things no matter what. My mom suggested that as a repercussion of my lie is to put a tracker on my phone, so that she could know where I am. I understand that it would be a trust issue if she didn't know where I was, but I think the phone tracker is just ridiculous and it's a huge invasion of privacy.  She seems pretty adamant about it, so I would have to give her a really good reason not to do it. Any ideas? Is it a good idea for me to be adamant about her not putting the tracker on my phone and just rebel against her? Or should I just try to come up with a reason for her not to track my phone? ### Response: 1) Should parents be able to track their kids phones without permission from the child? And should they be able to see all texts/calls made/received etc..? 2) What should I do (lie or

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: So I was out with a friend going to get lunch when another close friend of mine (also his ex) called out to me when she saw me. They hadn't seen each other in years. I waved, then ended up turning around in her direction to go and say hi.  I was pretty conscious about making either of them feel uncomfortable or awkward, so I thought I would keep it quick, we said our hellos, then parted way (there was a bit of an awkward silence at the end).  I texted her casually later on saying "lol that was awkward" just to make light of the situation.  I then got a response back saying that it wasn't awkward at the start, but that I made it awkward. Apparently I just waved and walked away (I was admittidely unsure what to do at the start, but did go to say hi), and apparently I didn't look like i wanted to talk.  I tried to explain that I just wasn't sure how to deal with the situation, to not make either party uncomfortable. But now I'm getting ignored.   So is there anything that I should be doing in this situation? It seems pretty awkward no matter what.... ### Response: 2 friends bump into eachother after manyyears, things became awkward due to my actions. What can I improve/do differently next time? Thanks! =D** EDIT: Grammar!^_^ Sorry for any mistake

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: Hi all, pretty soon we will be taking our baby on a cross-country flight. He'll be 9 months old at the time we travel.  I've been asking others about flying with baby stuff, and I'm still confused.  We'll be flying a non-stop Frontier flight. We figure at the very least he needs a car seat, a stroller, possibly his infant carrier depending on how big he is by then, and a portable crib.   It sounds like we can check his stroller at the gate.  Is there a charge for that?  Frontier's website isn't clear. If he's still in an infant carrier, will they also check that at the gate? We are fine hold him on our lap during the flight.  And if he's too big for his infant carrier, does his "big kid" car seat go to the gate, or through baggage? What about the base?   Are there fees for that?  Do you recommend we bring our own pack and play and check it through baggage, or buy a uber cheap one from a place at our destination?    Thanks so much in advance.  Please don't be too angry at me if this is a repeat discussion.  I tried searching for similar discussions but couldn't find anything similar to these questions in the recent past. ### Response: 9 month old baby, what stuff do we need to get to our destination, carry on/check?  Also any info onFrontier airlines policies would be great (if possible). :) Thank you!**EDIT:* -Just

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: Throwaway  Long story short we've been together almost 5 years. I was her first. She was my second (had very brief sex in the 11th grade, mixed in with a few other sexual encounters of a similar nature). When we met she was not very sexual at all, and the sex was pretty terrible. The Sex has gotten much better ranging from ok to amazing in the last year or so. She has opened up sexually and we've benefited from it.  My fear however is that as we creep closer to possible marriage she'll want to 'explore' what its like having sex with other people. Shes never said this, and the only time its been brought up was her being upset with me because I had had sex prior to the relationship. She has a ton of intimacy issues and has said that thinking about having sex with other people makes her stomach hurts. <s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: My boyfriend and I have been together for over a year. He's great, we always have a great time together. I don't take it out in him & I don't think he knows I feel this way because I never mentioned it to him but sometimes it makes me mad at him for a few days. I know he is faithful and I don't question the kind of people he hangs out with girls or boys.          Can you please help me think of more constructive ways to deal with my frustration. <s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: Hey Reddit,  This is a question I have always wanted to get an anonymous opinion on. I was diagnosed with ADHD in elementary school and I am now in my twenties. I understand many people don't take ADHD seriously, and view it as an excuse for laziness and special treatment.  I believe it is over-diagnosed and my opinions are complicated regarding its categorization as a "disorder". My behaviors when it comes to getting things done are extremely abnormal, and I often wonder if it is beneficial or harmful to tell people about this diagnosis.  What I am asking you guys is: How does/would your opinion of someone change when they tell you they have ADHD? What if they are a close friend, employee, student, etc? Would you take them seriously or assume that they are making excuses?  Any thoughts on the issue are appreciated, I don't often get the chance to hear these opinions in person but I know that they exist. ### Response: 25 M with ADD, Wondering what people think of people who have been diagnosed with ADD and whether telling people would be helpful or hurtful. Thanks! :)**  EDIT: Just want to say thank you so much for all

<s> ### Instruction: Generate a one-sentence summary of this post. ### Input: I'm so sick of browsing through Craigslist 'Free stuff' to see 10 different dogs, cats, and birds in "need of a new home'. If you post in free stuff it clearly says "NO ANIMALS" in parentheses.   PROOF:   I absolutely love animals and wish I could take them all but if I want a new animal I will browse Service > Pets where they SHOULD be posted. I'm sick of people who who have to move and can't take their pets with them. IF I got a pet I would consider if they could travel with me in ANY situation! IF you KNEW the condo doesn't allow pets looks for a different one that allows animals! IF your pet doesn't seem to like you after months of trying look for a trainer or pound! Take the strays to the pound! IF you can't take of your pet because of money problems, you shouldn't have gotten it in the first place! ### Response: If you don't like your current pet, try to find him/her a good home, sell it,or at least take it to the pound!! There are too many unwanted pets on craigslist!!!**
